text:
Path explosed by multiple '/' in url.
For example, http://greatcn.org/bbs/ works ok. But if one visits
http://greatcn.org//bbs/ he'll get the filesystem path: /home/coywolf/greatcn.org/.

http://greatcn.org//bbs/templates/subSilver/images/folder_big.gif 
=>
http://cnphpbb.com/forum/templates/subSilver/images//home/coywolf/greatcn.org//bbs/templates/subSilver/images/folder_big.gif

$ cat .htaccess
RewriteEngine on
RewriteRule (.*)   http://cnphpbb.com/forum/templates/subSilver/images/$1 [L]
creator: coywolf@greatcn.org
nd@perlig.de
text: Are you sure, this is HEAD? Which version of httpd are you using?

creator: nd@perlig.de
text:
I cannot reproduce the problem with this information. Please attach a rewritelog
(with loglevel 9). I bet you have more than that rewrite configuration running.
It looks like a missing RewriteBase somewhere.

(and please don't email me that you've responded, I see this anyway)

Thanks.

creator: coywolf@greatcn.org
text:
It won't help with a proper RewriteBase.
I can't settle this problem. I have avoided this problem by 
making
RewriteRule (.*)   http://cnphpbb.com/forum/templates/subSilver/images/$1 [L]
=>
RewriteRule images\/(.*)  
http://cnphpbb.com/forum/templates/subSilver/images/$1 [L]

Anyway, this is only avoiding the problem instead of solving.

So please attach a rewrite log, blind guessing doesn't help. If you don't have
access to the main server config, you should install a server locally and test
it there.

Thanks.
creator: nd@perlig.de
nd@perlig.de
text:
No further response. Assuming issue resolved. Please reopen the report if the
problem still persists and you can supply the requested information.
